name: Tu Tu Tun Lodge

reviews.title: A great place to stay
reviews.text: Tu Tu' Tun Lodge Gold Beach, Oregon

Tu Tu' Tun Lodge is rated by several travel magazines as one of the top 25 small hotels in the world. It is situated on the banks of the famous Rogue River in southern Oregon. The amenities at this lodge are luxurious. It has a really nice lobby with bar and fireplace, and dining room. It has a patio out back, flanked by a nice swimming pool which is surrounded by flowers. There are 20 luxurious rooms located in a two-story lodge building. There is also a cottage that is located in a finely manicured meadow that includes an apple orchard and grazing deer and elk. All the rooms have balconies that have a view of the river, which is less than 100 yards away. Some rooms have hot tubs on the balcony. The resort has a small dock where you can catch one of

reviews.text: Jerry's power boats to take a 52-mile trip up the river and back. The trip includes wildlife and rapids. You DO get wet. There are also shorter trips you can take.
reviews.title: Best place around
Honeymoon dream!
reviews.text: The staff here is SUPER friendly. The hostess calls you by your first name. Dinner is served every evening at 7:15 and the hostess (Terri) seats you and introduces you to the other guests. The food is exquisite northwest cuisine, four-course meals. It is gourmet cooking, cooked by a well-known female chef who is featured in travel magazines. The food here is excellent. After dinner, they light madrone wood fires out on the patio, where guests, like myself, sit under the stars and relax (with your favorite wine from the bar). You can see the silhouette of the mountains across the river.

reviews.title: Romantic!
reviews.text: The rooms are really special. They have scented bathrooms, fancy soaps and lotions, bathrobes available in the scented closets, soft beds with special soft goose-down pillows. There is turn-down service in the evenings, with four soft pillows, plus 3 large cushions on your bed. Some rooms have fireplaces.

I just completed a trip through Oregon and some of the finer spots for fly-fishing and other water oriented activities. At the end of the Rogue River is this fantastic lodge where they really know how to make travel weary and tired sportsmen (and presumably every other guest) feel great. From the staff, to the rooms, to the lodge to the grounds, all aspects of my stay were filled with the best hospitality.
reviews.title: They know hospitality!

likes.liked: — Talking with Dirk & Laurie at the bar
likes.disliked: — That I had to leave (work was calling)

reviews.title: Rustic Comfort/Excellent Service
reviews.text: Being a bit remote, the innkeepers took the time and trouble to anticipate the needs of their guests who may have left something behind or not been allowed to “carry on” certain grooming supplies. In my room was a large basket of every imaginable convenience and amenity and an implied “Welcome and help yourself.” While this is just one example of love, care and attention to detail the staff has put into each guests’ stay, there were innumerable others every where I turned. The entire compound is incredible inviting and welcoming. From a cup of coffee in the lounge, to a stroll by the river to guidance on the “hot” fishing spots and some pointers on technique to the amazing dining room and exquisite menu, Dirk, Laurie and the rest of the gang have really figured it out.

reviews.title: Tu Tu Tun, a very special inn
reviews.text: We loved our 2 nights at Tu Tu Tun. The ambience is excellent due to the diligence of owners, Laurie and Dirk. They manage to be everywhere, even to seating people at tables of 8 for dinner and managing to put you with very interesting people. The view and rooms have been described well, the Rogue River trip (especially the 104 mile one) is spectacular and fun, the cocktail hour is perfect for touching base with other guests. We were there for the salmon and roast beef dinners, both excellent. The breakfasts could have been a bit less extrvagant as most people are fussy about breakfast. However, they will happily fix you anything you request should the menu not suit you.

reviews.title: accommodations, A+..food, c-
reviews.text: Had to add this review when I read the one from NJ. He was exactly correct. We also stayed two nights and loved the room, grounds, jet boat ride, the people, the service. As was mentioned, the cocktail hour was wonderful, however dinner was strange...sturgeon!! It was really awful..no one at our table ate it, however, we were told that we missed a wonderful prime rib the nite before. The next morning salmon was served for breakfast. I don't know anyone in the south that eats fish for breakfast! Staff was very nice, although a little surprised that we asked, and fixed us bacon and eggs. We would go back, however, we would inquire as to the dinner menu and possible go into town if it didn't suit us.

description: A four-star property which offers fine dining and wonderful hospitality.
